titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the World Literature Lectures, Yale University
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 07:51

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of audio recordings of lectures by Yale professors on literary classics.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 47 (YRG 47), Collections documenting teaching and learning in Yale academic programs

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: World Literature Lectures, Yale University (RU 149). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by last name of professor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials consist of audio recordings of lectures by Yale professors on literary classics
